en_title: Secretary for Justice meets with Indonesian legal and law officials (with photos)
zh_title: 律政司司長與印尼司法和法律官員會面（附圖）

en: The Secretary for Justice, Mr Rimsky Yuen, SC, joined by some members of the Hong Kong delegation of legal and arbitration professionals, met with the Indonesian Attorney General, Mr H M Prasetyo, and the Minister of Law and Human Rights, Mr Yasonna Laoly, in Jakarta, Indonesia, today (September 18) to enhance legal exchanges and co-operation between the two places.

Mr Yuen briefed Mr Prasetyo on the successful implementation of "one country, two systems" in Hong Kong, highlighting that the rule of law and judicial independence are fully guaranteed by the Basic Law.
Both sides agreed to further enhance legal exchanges and co-operation between the two places, in particular on matters relating to mutual legal assistance.

In the meeting with Mr Laoly, Mr Yuen and the delegation members introduced Hong Kong's legal and dispute resolution services to the minister, in particular the services provided by various Hong Kong and international arbitration institutions.

Mr Yuen said Hong Kong has been very keen to explore legal co-operation between Hong Kong and Indonesia, which is a very close trading partner of Hong Kong. He and Mr Laoly agreed to foster closer ties between the legal and arbitration sectors of the two places and build up further dialogues.
zh: 律政司司長袁國強資深大律師聯同部分香港法律及仲裁專業人士代表團成員，今日（九月十八日）與印尼總檢察長H M Prasetyo及司法和人權部長Yasonna Laoly會面，加強兩地的司法交流和合作。
袁國強向Prasetyo表示「一國兩制」在香港成功落實，他並強調法治和司法獨立均受《基本法》全面保障。
雙方同意進一步加強兩地的司法交流和合作，特別是與相互法律協助有關的事宜。
袁國強和代表團成員與Laoly會面時，向他介紹香港的法律和解決爭議服務，特別是由多個香港和國際仲裁機構提供的服務。
袁國強表示，印尼是香港的緊密貿易夥伴，香港一直致力探討加強與印尼的司法合作。他和Laoly同意為兩地的法律和仲裁界建立更緊密的聯繫，並進一步增加對話。

en: The Secretary for Justice, Mr Rimsky Yuen, SC, joined by some members of the Hong Kong delegation of legal and arbitration professionals, met with the Indonesian Attorney General, Mr H M Prasetyo, and the Minister of Law and Human Rights, Mr Yasonna Laoly, in Jakarta, Indonesia, today (September 18) to enhance legal exchanges and co-operation between the two places.

Mr Yuen briefed Mr Prasetyo on the successful implementation of "one country, two systems" in Hong Kong, highlighting that the rule of law and judicial independence are fully guaranteed by the Basic Law.
Both sides agreed to further enhance legal exchanges and co-operation between the two places, in particular on matters relating to mutual legal assistance.

In the meeting with Mr Laoly, Mr Yuen and the delegation members introduced Hong Kong's legal and dispute resolution services to the minister, in particular the services provided by various Hong Kong and international arbitration institutions.
Mr Yuen said Hong Kong has been very keen to explore legal co-operation between Hong Kong and Indonesia, which is a very close trading partner of Hong Kong
He and Mr Laoly agreed to foster closer ties between the legal and arbitration sectors of the two places and build up further dialogues.
